Description: Fragment of Attic black-figured pottery closed vase; interior reserved; exterior: Siren to left, head reversed, perched on a palmette.
Producer name: Attributed to the Manner of: The KX Painter
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 231, no. 167)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 123, no. 347.6, pl. XXXVIII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2006)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5965 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
